page.title: 06SECONDARY EDUCATION
page.content: THORPE-LE-SOKEN IS FORTUNATE IN HAVING THE JUNIOR SECTION OF TENDRING HIGH SCHOOL WITHIN THE VILLAGE. THE SCHOOL WAS FORMERLY LANDERMERE SECONDARY SCHOOL BUT IN 1973 IT MERGED WITH GUNFLEET SECONDARY SCHOOL IN FRINTON TO FORM A COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL, WITH THE JUNIOR SECTION ON THE THORPE SITE CATERING FOR PUPILS AGED FROM 11 TO 14 YEARS. THE SCHOOL SERVES A VERY WIDE AREA, FROM GREAT OAKLEY TO LITTLE CLACTON AND FROM WEELEY TO WALTON-ON-THE-NAZE. MOST OF THE PUPILS ARE BROUGHT IN BY COACH. THE SCHOOL BUILDINGS ARE MODERN, WITH A LARGE HALL EQUIPPED FOR DRAMA PRODUCTIONS, A GYMNASIUM AND AN OPEN-AIR SWIMMING POOL. A MUSIC BLOCK WAS ADDED FAIRLY RECENTLY. THERE IS A LARGE PLAYING FIELD WITH FACILITIES FOR HOCKEY, RUGBY,FOOTBALL AND ATHLETICS, AND TENNIS AND NETBALL COURTS.
